Returns: a string representation of the object.
toString().Description: Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method. The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of:

getPosition().Description: Get the playback position in ms at last position update time.

getCustomActions().Description: Get the list of custom actions.

getErrorCode().Description: Get the error code. This should be set when the state is @B_android#support#v4#media#session#PlaybackStateCompat#STATE_ERROR_E@.

Returns: the key code matched to the given action.
Parameters: long: The action to be translated.
toKeyCode(long).Description: Translates a given action into a matched key code defined in https:##developer#android#com@B_android#view#KeyEvent_E@. The given action should be one of the following: @B_android#support#v4#media#session#PlaybackStateCompat#ACTION_PLAY_E@ @B_android#support#v4#media#session#PlaybackStateCompat#ACTION_PAUSE_E@ @B_android#support#v4#media#session#PlaybackStateCompat#ACTION_SKIP_TO_NEXT_E@ @B_android#support#v4#media#session#PlaybackStateCompat#ACTION_SKIP_TO_PREVIOUS_E@ @B_android#support#v4#media#session#PlaybackStateCompat#ACTION_STOP_E@ @B_android#support#v4#media#session#PlaybackStateCompat#ACTION_FAST_FORWARD_E@ @B_android#support#v4#media#session#PlaybackStateCompat#ACTION_REWIND_E@ @B_android#support#v4#media#session#PlaybackStateCompat#ACTION_PLAY_PAUSE_E@

Returns: The last time the position was updated.
getLastPositionUpdateTime().Description: Get the elapsed real time at which position was last updated. If the position has never been set this will return 0;

getPlaybackSpeed().Description: Get the current playback speed as a multiple of normal playback. This should be negative when rewinding. A value of 1 means normal playback and 0 means paused.

Returns: The id of the currently active item in the queue or @B_android#support#v4#media#session#MediaSessionCompat#QueueItem#UNKNOWN_ID_E@.
getActiveQueueItemId().Description: Get the id of the currently active item in the queue. If there is no queue or a queue is not supported by the session this will be @B_android#support#v4#media#session#MediaSessionCompat#QueueItem#UNKNOWN_ID_E@.

Returns: The extras for this state or null.
getExtras().Description: Get any custom extras that were set on this playback state.

int: Additional flags about how the object should be written. May be 0 or @B_android#os#Parcelable#PARCELABLE_WRITE_RETURN_VALUE_E@.
writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel, int).Description: Flatten this object in to a Parcel.

ClassDesc: Playback state for a @B_android#support#v4#media#session#MediaSessionCompat_E@. This includes a state like @B_android#support#v4#media#session#PlaybackStateCompat#STATE_PLAYING_E@, the current playback position, and the current control capabilities.
